intro: Agastache rugosa f. alba, commonly known as white hyssop, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pale lavender. The plant produces aromatic, mint-scented leaves that are often used in herbal teas and traditional medicine. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Agastache rugosa f. alba is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
